thread.title: ‘I think people might need a break from me’
thread.title_full: ‘I think people might need a break from me’

title: ‘I think people might need a break from me’
text:
‘I think people might need a break from me’ 6:35 AM Bryan Hood EVEN Taylor Swift knows there’s such a thing as too much. The pop star has said that it might be time for a vacation. Classic Xmas carol is returned to heirs 5:57 AM Josh Saul AFTER a protracted court battle, Santa Claus Is Comin’ to Town is comin’ right back into the hands of the family of the songwriter who composed it. Scott Disick is still drooling over Kourtney 5:40 AM Derrick Bryson Taylor IT’S obvious that Scott Disick still has the hots for Kourtney Kardashian after he shared a nude photo of the reality TV star on his Instagram. Full-frontal nude photos of Bieber run online 5:39 AM Staff Writers THE internet went into meltdown today when photos of the cocky 21-year-old singer walking around in the buff in Bora Bora were published online. Why Gomez really ditched her Aussie tour 5:39 AM Network Writers SELENA Gomez has shocked her fans by revealing the real reason she canned her 2013 tour of Australia. She was secretly wrestling with an insidious condition. Latham: Sydney has a ‘Muslim problem’ 5:37 AM Emily Moulton CHANNEL 9’s foray into an evening current affairs panel show was what you would have expected: Full of controversial remarks, one-liners and spirited debate. There’s a bong in there 1:32 AM Network Writers SO what is Alex Papps making now? Play School host lights up social media with his on-air project — which looks exactly like a bong. The Cruel Sea’s guitarist dies 0:30 AM AAP and Network Writers THE Australian music industry is in mourning after the death of James Cruickshank, the much-loved guitarist for The Cruel Sea. Taylor Swift needs a break from being Taylor Swift October 9, 2015 5:38am Email a friend 
EVEN Taylor Swift knows there’s such a thing as too much. 
The pop star, coming off a year in which her album 1989 dominated the charts, told NME magazine that it might be time for a vacation. 
“I think I should take some time off,” the 25-year-old told the magazine. 
“I think people might need a break from me. I’m going to … I don’t know. Hang out with my friends. Write new music. Maybe not write new music. I don’t know.” Taylor Swift spoke to UK magazine NME. Picture: Jordan Hughes/NME Source: Supplied 
Though she’s thoroughly enjoyed seeing all her hard work pay off (and earning her an unexpected Emmy to boot), the increased time in the spotlight, even by her standards, comes with its own set of drawbacks. 
“I’m in the news every single day for multiple different reasons,” she told the magazine. 
“And it can feel, at times, if you let your anxiety get the better of you, like everybody’s waiting for you to really mess up — and then you’ll be done.” Having the time of her life. Picture: Jordan Hughes/NME Source: Supplied 
Fortunately for Swift, while she may now be the biggest music star in the world, she is still surrounded by people who keep her grounded and connected to who she really is. 
“A lot of the time I need to call my mum and talk for a really long time, just to remind myself of all the things that are great and all the things that matter,” she said. 
“If you do something that defines your character to be not what the public thought you were, that’s the biggest risk.” 
Whether or not she does take some much-needed downtime, there’s one thing Swift knows she won’t attempt in the near future: to surpass the critical and popular bar she set with 1989. 
“N ,” she said. 
“How could the next one be as big? Maybe the next album will be a bridge to somewhere else. Or maybe I’ll just go ahead and change everything.” Perhaps she’s after more time with boyfriend Calvin Harris? Picture: Jeff Kravitz/BMA2015/FilmMagic Having the time of her life. Picture: Jordan Hughes/NME Source: Supplied
